intro: Guatteria hilariana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, making it an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
